TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG ( prokurator wojewódzki ) instituted an investigation in regard to suspected child trafficking . DATE the prosecutor heard CARDINAL witnesses and conducted several other procedural activities , including the appointment of interpreters for CARDINAL NORP nationals to be heard in the case . The applicant submits that those QUANTITY foreigners were PERSON , who was one of the accused persons , and his wife .
On DATE the prosecutor charged the applicant with child trafficking and incitement to false testimony .

On DATE the applicant was heard . On the same date the prosecutor appointed CARDINAL medical experts in order to assess whether the applicant ’s state of health prevented him from being kept in detention . They found no medical obstacles to the applicant ’s detention .
On DATE the prosecutor remanded him in custody . Between CARDINAL DATE and DATE the prosecutor interrogated other suspects and witnesses in the case .

On DATE the prosecutor decided to submit a letter rogatory to competent authorities in GPE requesting the examination of CARDINAL witnesses . The applicant submits that those letters concerned PERSON , who had been previously heard in the case , and PERSON , who was counsel for PERSON
The applicant appealed against the decision to remand him in custody , but on DATE ORG ( sąd wojewódzki ) dismissed his appeal .
On DATE an expert in cardiology , having been so ordered by the prosecutor , prepared an opinion , according to which the applicant should not be kept in detention .
On DATE the applicant was released on bail .
In DATE the prosecutor heard further witnesses .
On DATE she decided to prolong the investigation , relying , among other reasons , on the NORP authorities’ failure to carry out the letter rogatory .
On DATE the prosecutor refused the applicant ’s request to be released from the bail requirements . On DATE his appeal against that decision was dismissed .
On DATE the prosecutor brought charges against another individual .
On DATE and DATE the investigation was further prolonged in view of the NORP authorities’ failure to execute the letter rogatory .
On DATE the prosecutor refused the applicant ’s further request to be released from the bail requirements .
Subsequently , on CARDINAL occasions the prosecutor again prolonged the investigation , relying each time on the difficulties with the execution of the letter rogatory .
On DATE the prosecutor refused the applicant ’s further request for release from the bail requirements . His appeal against that decision was dismissed on DATE .
On DATE the testimony given by the CARDINAL NORP witnesses was submitted to ORG .
On DATE the prosecutor decided that a part of the case would be examined in a separate set of proceedings .
On DATE the applicant notified the Minister of Justice about criminal offences allegedly committed , inter alia , by ORG in the course of the investigation .
On DATE the prosecutor rejected an evidence motion submitted by the applicant .

On DATE the prosecutor submitted to ORG the bill of indictment . The indictment comprised allegations in respect of CARDINAL individuals , including the applicant . CARDINAL of them was a NORP national . The prosecutor requested the court to summon CARDINAL witnesses , including CARDINAL NORP nationals .
On DATE ORG requested ORG to transmit the case to another court .
On DATE ORG transferred the case to ORG , relying on the fact that the applicant was a lawyer practising in the region covered by ORG jurisdiction .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s and another accused person ’s requests for the discontinuance of the proceedings .
The hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned sine die because of the absence of PERSON In DATE submitted a sick certificate .
On DATE the President of ORG assigned a judge to replace CARDINAL of the judges in the applicant ’s case , who had retired .
The hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned because of U. K. ’s continuing absence .
On DATE the court requested ORG in GPE and GPE to submit case files of criminal cases similar to the applicant ’s case , examined by those courts .
On DATE the court refused the applicant ’s further request for the discontinuance of the proceedings .
PERSON failed to attend the hearing held on DATE and the court decided to adjourn the examination of the charges against him to a separate set of proceedings .

At the hearing held on DATE the court imposed a fine on witness PERSON , who was a victim in the case , for her failure to attend the hearing despite having been duly summoned . Subsequently , her mother informed the court that PERSON resided abroad and she would not attend the hearing scheduled for DATE .
On DATE the court held a hearing .
On DATE it ordered the police of PERSON place of residence to submit information concerning her whereabouts .
The court held a hearing on DATE . It fined CARDINAL witnesses who failed to appear before it although duly summoned .
The court held further hearings on DATE and DATE .

Subsequently , the presiding judge fixed the dates of further hearings for CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE , anticipating a possibility to examine witness PERSON could not be heard on the former date and the hearing scheduled for that date did not take place .
The court heard PERSON at the hearing on CARDINAL DATE .
It held another hearing on DATE .

On DATE the court gave judgment . The applicant was convicted of inciting PERSON and PERSON to give false testimony and sentenced to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , suspended for DATE . He was acquitted of child trafficking . The judgment was accompanied by CARDINAL pages of reasoning . The applicant , as well as one of the other accused persons and the prosecutor , appealed .
On DATE ORG ( sąd apelacyjny ) acquitted the applicant of inciting PERSON to give false testimony . It dismissed the remainder of his appeal .
